messages.content:
find any sentences that are not completed and other issues and share it in a way so i can find and fix them:
DESIGN, BUILD & OPERATE AGREEMENT 
Municipality of Baghdad Wastewater Treatment Plant
Baghdad, Iraq

THIS AGREEMENT is dated 19th March, 2024.


BETWEEN: 

Party 1:
World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co. (WWGC Ltd. Co.) Registration in the Companies Registrar Department / Ministry of Commerce in Iraq No. 26004 on 2/5/2005.
Represented by: Mr. Nova Kojaian

AND

Advance Pipeline Services UK, (ADPS). Registration in the Companies House in Cardiff no  on 29 July 2020. 
Address: 15 Glenroy Street, Roath Cardiff CF24 3IK , United Kingdom
Represented by: Dr. Falah Hasan Mustafa

AND
Party 2: 
Water Engineering Technologies, LLC, (WET LLC) Entity ID at the Corporations Division in Michigan: 801785495
Address: 2626 Packard Rd Ann Arbor MI 48104 USA
Represented by: Dr. Saad Ghalib

Each individually referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties".

THE PROJECT(S):
The Medical City Wastewater Treatment Plant
AND/OR
The Zuyut Factory Wastewater Treatment Plant

Table Of Contents:
Table Of Contents:
Background
Scope of Services.
1. Contractual Relationship.
1.A - Party 1 Contributions
1.B - Party 2 Contributions.
2. License, Compensation, and Payments
2.1 Licensing payments for intellectual property
2.2 - Profit sharing by stages of the project implementation
Payment Terms
2.3 - Payments for detailed design
2.4 Payments for construction oversight
3- Profit Sharing
3.1 Executive Summary
3.2 Payment terms
4. Confidential Information:
5. Warranties:
6. Further Actions:
7. Exclusivity
8. Comprehensiveness
9. Authority
10. Decision-Making Process
10.1 Design
10.2 Construction Oversight
10.3 Dispute Resolution
12. Indemnification and Liability:
13 Duration.
Addendums and Exhibits
EXHIBIT A – Responsibility Matrix
EXHIBIT B – Party Contractual Relationship
EXHIBIT C – Party 1 Responsibilities
EXHIBIT D – Party 2 Responsibilities
EXHIBIT E – Party 2 Organization Chat
EXHIBIT F – Preliminary Project Cost

Background

All parties aim to market, bid for, and secure a design/build/operate contract for the Project(s) as outlined in this document.
The Parties intend to cooperate by leveraging the individual and collective expertise in accordance with the agreed terms.
All references to currency in this Term Sheet are in US dollars
Scope of Services.
Professional engineering support services related to Treatment Shaft wastewater treatment facility design and construction observation as part of a design-build- contract Between (Party 1 and The Client). The scope of work is as follows:

The project is a 150,000 m3/day average flow wastewater treatment plant at the Medical City and or Zuyut Factory outfall locations.
The wastewater treatment plant is to incorporate specified technology and any future modifications as developed during the execution of this contract.
Discharge of treated effluent to Tigris River during dry and wet weather conditions (combined sewer overflow). 

NOW, THEREFORE, THE PARTIES AGREE TO THE FOLLOWING TERMS AS STATED IN THIS WRITTEN AGREEMENT. 

1. Contractual Relationship. 
The Parties will provide shared services for The Project(s) using Party 2’s Treatment Shaft technology. Both Wastewater Treatment Plants (WWTPs) average capacity is in the range of 150,000 m3/day. 

The Parties’ contractual relationship and responsibilities are presented in Exhibits A and B. Specific terms and responsibilities among the parties are detailed in Exhibit C and Exhibit D.

The two parties in this agreement shall do their best to qualify for their participation and display their technical capabilities appropriately to win the projects and use for that purpose their accumulated experience and updated market studies.
Both Parties are jointly and severally liable for successfully completing the Design, Build, and Operation of the above projects.
Each Party bears its administrative expenses separately during the bidding process. Those directly related to the project after obtaining the contract with the Municipality will be agreed upon. 
The two parties undertake to spend the amounts obtained through the Municipality (beneficiary entity) and as detailed in the proposal exclusively to complete the work on the above Projects, as it is not permissible to spend any amount, whatever its value, on any other project, regardless of its importance, and under any pretext or reason, except with the agreement of the two Parties. The amounts of funds for the above Project(s) shall be received from the Municipality, and the process of disbursing the funds will be limited to Party 1 or their officially authorized representatives as defined in the decision-making process below.
Approval of submittals, including mechanical, electrical, structural, and other submittals that deviate from the original design, will be the responsibility of Party 2.
The two parties are obligated to inform each other of any communications received out of context received from other parties related to the participation, regardless of their type (photocopies or by email). 
The two parties, or their representatives, will attend meetings with the stakeholders (Municipality, etc.) when needed and where needed (at the Municipality headquarters or otherwise).
The two parties have no right to sell the contract (secretly or publicly) to any person, group, or company, whether (Iraqi, Arab, or foreign) under any reason unless to a subsidiary company owned by any of the parties subsequently incorporated in Iraq.
The provisions of this agreement apply to any changes that may occur during the implementation of the project(s).
Parties’ participation in this agreement does not prevent either Party from independently entering separate contractual obligations in any other projects, and this does not entail any obligations for the other Party, except for any similar project in Iraq where both parties are obliged to work exclusively together unless otherwise agreed.
1.A - Party 1 Contributions

As per details found in Exhibit C
1.B - Party 2 Contributions. 

Offering use of its patented technology and expertise in designing Treatment Shaft technology for the Project. 
Party 2 is responsible for providing successful and practical Treatment Shaft Technology for the treatment of the Municipal effluent in the Medical City within the area (105m X 105m approximately) provided by the Municipality, 
Supporting the completion of the first WWTP project, namely Medical City (or the second Zuyut WWTP) in Baghdad, with a capacity of 150,000 m3/day within the agreement's term with consultant engineers, design oversight and support.  
Providing Concept design of the plant and layout, with Owner input and acceptance for the project(s).
Party 2 is responsible for searching, identifying, selecting, and negotiating the contract with the design consultant, in coordination and support of Party 1.
Party 2 is responsible for searching, identifying, selecting, and negotiating the contract for hiring a design manager and internal or external QA/QC team.
Party 2 is responsible for overseeing the completion of the preliminary design and final design by the design consultant to ensure project completion according to the project intent. 
Hiring and managing  a full time representative oversight engineer to oversee construction activities and respond to field conditions that require the design team's input and to facilitate and coordinate with Party 1 to improve communication and facilitate performance. The oversight engineering team will consist of a dedicated full-time resident engineer supported by specialty engineers as necessary, alongside the staff from the design engineering firm. 

During the Operating and Maintenance Period
Party 2 has no predefined responsibilities, scope of work, or budget during the O&M period post-construction.
If requested by Party 1, Party 2 will engage to assist during the O&M period.
Party 2 will develop and submit a scope of work and budget for any such assistance at a later stage of construction.
This scope and budget will require Party 1's approval and will be added as an addendum to this contract.
Staffing, responsibilities, budget, and communications protocols between Party 1 and Party 2 for the oversight engineer's activities will follow the same decision-making process defined below.


2. License, Compensation, and Payments

2.1 Licensing payments for intellectual property
Under this agreement, the licensing fees for the use of the intellectual property (patent) are to be paid to Party 2 in the amount of (3,000,000 USD) three million US dollars as follows:
Payment of an amount of (150,000 USD) one hundred and fifty thousand US dollars at the beginning of the work upon signing the contract with the beneficiary party upon receipt of the down payment or any payment.
Payment of an amount of (150,000 USD) one hundred and fifty thousand US dollars upon the completion of the fieldwork and the transfer of the data from the vertical treatment shaft process pilot study to the WET and his Design Consultant.
The remaining license fees, amounting to (2,700,000 USD) two million seven hundred thousand US dollars, will be paid on a pro-rata basis (proportional) to the design progress percentage (15%, 30%, 60%, 90%).
Payment for the full license amount will be completed when the design reaches 100% completion, as defined by having the final design documents reviewed and approved by a 3rd party and the Municipality
Any deductions or retainers from the project budget by the beneficiary will be deducted from the profit sharing described in Section 2.B below.
As for any future projects beyond the two projects specifically listed in this agreement, the fees, expenses, and method of payment will be decided mutually between the two parties on a project-by-project basis and according to the agreement concluded at the time.
2.2 - Profit sharing by stages of the project implementation
Party 2 is a primary partner in all stages of design and construction of the project and will receive an 18% (eighteen percent) profit share in US dollars from the expected profits prorated over time and disbursed upon achieving positive cash flow during the progress of the design and construction phases and following the payments received from the client. 
The profit is calculated as the total value of the contract minus all actual costs related to the project (such as design and construction costs, including materials and equipment, financial expenses, client retainer or deduction, taxes, licensing fees, royalty (patent fees) contractor’s general expenses and overheads, and any fees directly related to the project. 

The project accountant will provide regular monthly reports to all parties.  All parties have the right to review the project’s cash balance and accounts. 
Payment Terms
A profit-sharing payment schedule is to be agreed upon by the parties once the payment schedule is established in the contract with the beneficiary. Profit forecasts will be evaluated at the start of the project and quarterly during project construction. 
2.3 - Payments for detailed design
The complete design of the project will be budgeted at cost and paid by the Party 2.
All Party 2 related project costs will be covered by the project budget (for example: essential hires such as engineers, consulting firm and support staff, travel expenses, accommodation services, personal expenses during travel, company registration, legal support in Turkey and Iraq, accountant services, secretarial services and drafting, etc).
The design consulting firm and Party 2 staff overseeing and managing the design and performing the QA/QC will be paid by Party 1
The scope of work and budget for the final design by the consultant and Party 2 QA/QC  and support staff such as project manager, drafting, secretarial and accounting will be estimated at the end of the pilot study and before the start of the design phase. The scope of work and budget will be submitted by Party 2 for approval within a week  by Party 1. 
The fees for the design consultant will be as stated in the contract between the design consultant and Party 2 for completing the project’s design (plans and specifications). The cost will include design consultant fees, travel/accommodation, and design-related expenses by the design consultant.
The fees for the QA/QC team, Party 2’s project manager andindependent consultants if needed, will include project-related expenses such as insurance and travel/accommodation costs.      
Party 2 will be responsible for the approval on a monthly basis the design consultant’s invoices, the QA/QC team and support engineering  invoices, and will forward these invoices after approval by Party 2 to Party 1 for payment within one week of submission.
Steve Williams’ expenses of 150,000 USD for design activities will be covered by the project and paid during the design progress payment. His role will be to assist the design team with Process Engineering and Hydraulics work. He will be part of the QA/QC team during the review process

2.4 Payments for construction oversight
The costs of the construction oversight engineering team and expenses will be paid at the actual cost by Party 1. 
The construction oversight team’s scope of work and budget will be developed jointly (Party 1 & Party 2) before the start of the construction phase and the costs to be paid by Party 1 will include:
The cost of the construction oversight team.
Expenses related to the construction oversight team such as trailer, stationary, communication, computer, and other field supplies expenses, and travel/accommodations if not covered by Party 1. 
Party 1 will be responsible for the payments for the construction oversight team according to approved monthly invoices submitted by Party 2 and based on the construction schedule. 
The scope and budget for Party 2’s contribution including  the design consultant will be determined before the start of the construction work and will be submitted to Party 1 for approval and before work begins. The scope of work and budget will be part of a separate addendum to this contract.
Party 2 is responsible for hiring and directing a project manager and subcontracting QA/QC and construction oversight engineering. Costs, including operational expenses like travel and lodging, will be covered by the project. A detailed plan on Party 2’s team structure and responsibilities will be submitted for review.

3- Profit Sharing
3.1 Executive Summary

Party 2 is a partner in the overall project and will receive an 18% profit sharing in USD.

The profit is calculated as contract total value minus all project-related costs such as direct design and construction costs, including material, equipment, financial expenses, taxes, design, license fees, contractor overhead and expenses, and any fees directly related to the project, excluding any expenses not related to the project costs. 

Regular monthly reports will be provided by Party 1’s project accountant to all parties.
All parties have the right to have access to the project and account cash balance periodically or as requested by each party. 
3.2 Payment terms
Profit sharing will be paid upon achieving positive cash flow during the progress of the design and construction phases and according to the project schedule.
Profit projection will be assessed during the construction of the project, a rough estimate is presented in Exhibit F- Preliminary Project Cost which is submitted as part of the project proposal.
The profit-sharing payment schedule will be agreed upon by the Parties as soon as the payment schedule is established in the contract with the Municipality. To be removed repetition)

4. Confidential Information: 

The recipients of Party 2 specific confidential/patented technology information agree to restrict its use of such information to the purpose of this Agreement and will not permit any other use of the same without the prior written consent of Party  2. 

5. Warranties: 

Both parties warrant the following: 
No ongoing or pending lawsuits to their knowledge that affect their financial and operational capability. 
Neither Party's history includes insolvency, bankruptcy, or criminal charges. 
Each party is liable for his task (as per the responsibility chart in exhibits A, C, and D)

6. Further Actions: 

Both Parties will explore the optimal structure for marketing and implementing Party 2's technology for potential projects for the Municipality of Baghdad. Alliances with third parties may be considered on a case-by-case basis and upon mutual approval by both parties in advance.
This Agreement will be the basis for the final signed Agreement to be drafted in Iraq and notarized by a public notary in Baghdad, Iraq.
The contract will be completed and signed in English and Arabic, upon a professional translation of this document, and notarized in Iraq. 

7. Exclusivity 

This Agreement is based on an exclusive teaming arrangement for the Municipality of Baghdad. 

The exclusivity granted in this Agreement is based on Party 1 availability to perform. Each party has the right to terminate this exclusive teaming arrangement with three months’ written notice. The exclusive arrangement is not implied or granted in other areas. Terms and conditions in this Agreement are for the two projects stated in this Agreement. Any future work will be negotiated on a project-by-project basis. Participation of other partners may be considered depending on the need for such partnership. Each party will be responsible for their marketing and presentation expenses.

8. Comprehensiveness 

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement of the Parties and supersedes any prior written or oral agreements between them relating to the Information; may only be amended by a written document duly signed by the Parties; and shall be binding upon the successors and assigns of each of the Parties.


9. Authority

The Parties’ representatives signing this agreement each have the full authority to enter into this Agreement and to disclose the Information.


10. Decision-Making Process
10.1 Design
Party 2 is responsible for researching and selecting an appropriate design consulting company in coordination with and with the help of Party 1. 
Party 2 is responsible for selecting the WET team and short-term outside consultants for oversight, management, and QA/QC staff that covers the major disciplines including process, structural, geotechnical, M/E, instrumentation and control, and hydraulics. The QA/QC will be commissioned on an as-needed basis and during the progress of the design, according to global best practices. 
The final design and WET QA/QC scope of work and budget will be developed by Party 2 at the end of the pilot study and before the start of the design. 
The design and QA/QC scope of work and budget will be submitted by Party 2 to Party 1. Party 1 will be responsible to review and approve the document within a maximum time of one week from the date of submission.

10.2 Construction Oversight
Party 2 bears responsibility for researching and selecting the team for the construction oversight and submitted to Party 1 for approval within one week of submission.
Party 2 is responsible for submitting WET’s Construction Oversight scope of work and budget. It will be submitted to Party 1 for review and approval within one week of the date of submission. 
Party 1 is responsible for submitting the Construction Program and budget to Party Two for review and approval within one week of the date of submission. 
10.3 Dispute Resolution
In the event of a dispute, the parties to this Agreement will use their best efforts to resolve the dispute amicably. Otherwise, the parties will seek arbitration to resolve the dispute through a three-person dispute review committee independent of the signatory parties to this Agreement. Each party chooses its representative on the dispute review committee, and the two members of the dispute review committee choose the third member of the dispute review committee. If the parties do not agree on the dispute review then the dispute shall be resolved through local courts in Baghdad and its decision will be final and binding.

12. Indemnification and Liability:

Each Party agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the other Party and their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, and representatives from and against any claims, demands, suits, actions, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorney's fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach of this Term Sheet, any act or omission by the indemnifying Party, or any infringement of intellectual property rights. This indemnification shall survive the termination of this agreement.
Both parties bear individual and joint responsibility for successfully completing the designs, construction, and operation of the project(s) mentioned in this contract as long as decisions are made according to the decision-making process described in this document.

13 Duration. 
Activation of this Agreement starts upon signing the first contract with the Municipality for either of the two projects referenced above. The duration of this Agreement is for the duration of the project and terminates upon completion of O&M phase. 

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the date stated below. 

Party 1:

_____________________________
SIGNED BY Mr. Nova Kojaian of WWGC LTD Co.

_____________________________
SIGNED BY Dr. Falah Mustafa of ADPS

Party 2: 

_____________________________
SIGNED BY Dr. Saad Ghalib of WET LLC.

Addendums and Exhibits
The following are additional materials and supporting documents added for clarity.
EXHIBIT A – Responsibility Matrix












EXHIBIT B – Party Contractual Relationship





















EXHIBIT C – Party 1 Responsibilities

Scope of Services. Complete the construction of the project described in the design-build contract between the client and Party 1 and according to the plans and specifications developed as part of the design provided by Party  2.
150,000 m3/d average flow wastewater treatment plant at the Medical City and or Zuit Factory outfall location.
Discharge of disinfected effluent to Tigris River during wet weather conditions (combined sewer overflow).

Outline of Services.
Contracting with Municipality.
Project construction management 
Recruitment of all type of manpower needed for the construction of the project including all subcontractors 
Provide labor and construction equipment appropriate for the scope of work and size of the project.
Purchase project equipment per plans and specifications.
Perform land survey, geotechnical investigation, sewer survey per design consultant request.
Collect information from the municipality to support the design which includes but not limited to pump station flow data, influent water quality, property ownership and boundary delineation, permit and approval requirements, other information needed by the design engineer. 
Perform on site Column Test as specified by Party  2. Data from the Column Test will be shared with Party  2 and the design consultant. 
Share post construction data monitoring test results with Party  2 and the design consultant to assess performance.
Arrange financing to the project at cost.
Apply QA/Qc and health and safety procedures at site.

EXHIBIT D – Party 2 Responsibilities

Outline of Services:
Assessing qualifications, interviewing, and final selection of a design engineering consultant.
Coordinate and work directly with the design consultant and ensure critical design criteria and information are communicated to the design consultant and implemented in the design.
Assist Party 1 in the establishment of permitting requirements.
Coordinate between design consultant and Party 1 to complete land survey, soil exploration, identify utility location and define property limits available for the project.
Provide the concept / preliminary design of the plant and the layout - with Owner input and acceptance.
Budget and cost tracking of design consultants and managing any change orders or additional services required by the team.
Oversee and manage design consultants including work progress, developing design details, providing input to consultants on a timely basis and monitor compliance of the design with the project design criteria and performance expectations. 
Assist Party 1 in final selection of equipment and construction procedures.
Provide construction observation oversite by qualified staff including civil and E/M. Full resident engineer supported with others including other specialized disciplines (QA/QC) depending on work progress and demand. Party  1 will provide furnished site trailers or offices with electricity, internet, and other supplies to oversight engineers.
Timely response to field conditions that require design consultant’s input.
Review supplier submittals and assist in addressing requests for information.
Review shop drawings and as built drawings prepared by Party  1.
Participation in Party 1 production of O&M manuals.
Party 2 has no defined role or budget beyond the completion of project construction and for the operation of the facility offered by Party 1. If Party 1 requests Party 2 contribution, Party 2 scope and budget will be determined at that time and submitted to Party 1 for approval prior to commencing the work. The scope of work and budget will be part of an addendum or separate agreement. 





EXHIBIT E – Party 2 Organization Chat






EXHIBIT F – Preliminary Project Cost 
(THE FINAL COST WILL BE INSERTED INSTEAD) 



---End of Agreement—

I have reviewed the provided text of the "Design, Build & Operate Agreement" for the Municipality of Baghdad Wastewater Treatment Plant and identified the following incomplete sentences and issues:

1. **Incomplete Registration Detail**:
   - Under "BETWEEN: Party 1", the registration number for Advance Pipeline Services UK (ADPS) is missing. It's mentioned as "Registration in the Companies House in Cardiff no on 29 July 2020."

2. **Repetition in Table of Contents**:
   - The phrase "Table Of Contents:" is repeated twice.

3. **Numerical Inconsistency in Sections**:
   - The sections skip from "10.3 Dispute Resolution" to "12. Indemnification and Liability." Section 11 is missing or not included.

4. **Formatting Issue in Exhibit Listings**:
   - The phrase "EXHIBIT A – Responsibility Matrix" is followed by numerous blank lines, which may be a formatting error. This formatting issue also appears after each Exhibit heading, creating unnecessary space.

5. **Ambiguity in Payment Terms (Section 2.3)**:
   - The sentence "The fees for the QA/QC team, Party 2’s project manager andindependent consultants if needed, will include project-related expenses..." contains a typo ("andindependent" should be "and independent"). Additionally, the clarity could be improved.

6. **Unclear Reference to Steve Williams (Section 2.3)**:
   - Steve Williams is mentioned without previous introduction: "Steve Williams’ expenses of 150,000 USD for design activities..." This might require clarification or an earlier introduction.

7. **Typo in Section 7 (Exclusivity)**:
   - "Each party has the right to terminate this exclusive teaming arrangement with three months’ written notice. The exclusive arrangement is not implied or granted in other areas." This sentence could be more clearly structured.

8. **Ambiguous Duration Specification (Section 13)**:
   - The duration of the agreement is specified as "for the duration of the project," which is somewhat circular and may benefit from a more specific timeframe or conditions for termination.

9. **Placeholder in Exhibit F**:
   - "EXHIBIT F – Preliminary Project Cost (THE FINAL COST WILL BE INSERTED INSTEAD)" - This appears to be a placeholder note that should be updated with actual content.

These are the primary issues and incomplete sentences identified in the text. It's advisable to review and address these points for clarity and completeness of the agreement.
